cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 155 miles SE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest, expected to turn north then north-northeast, crossing west-central Florida Wednesday–Thursday and sliding toward northeast Florida/Georgia coast by Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west coast of Florida (likely between Sarasota and Tampa Bay)

weather_observation.under_watch: Tropical Storm Watch; Storm Surge Watch
weather_observation.watch_coast: Altamaha Sound GA southward to Jupiter Inlet FL, including the St. Johns River and Jacksonville area
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and Storm-Surge Warnings currently limited to Florida’s west coast from the Anclote River southward to Flamingo, including Tampa Bay (not applicable to Jacksonville)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, northeast Florida Atlantic coast, Georgia and South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible (sustained 35–45 mph, gusts 50–60 mph) beginning late Wednesday night or Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential inundation 2–4 ft above ground along the St. Johns River and adjacent Atlantic shoreline
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–10 inches with local amounts to 12 inches, leading to flash and urban flooding and river rises
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes beginning late Wednesday; dangerous surf and rip currents along northeast Florida beaches
